name: politico
text:
A bipartisan proposal to change how the feds surveil U.S. persons could raise foreign partners’ concerns about sharing intelligence with the U.S., DOJ officials told POLITICO hours before an expected vote on the change

https://t.co/0gXNMPuJLu

name: politico
text:
NIH Director Francis Collins said the coronavirus is “absolutely not" manmade but he could not rule out the idea that it escaped from a lab in Wuhan, China, where the first known cases emerged

https://t.co/VWLCxYiE7J

name: politico
text:
About 17 minutes before NASA astronauts Robert Behnken and Douglas Hurley were set to blast into space today from the SpaceX Crew Dragon, their scheduled liftoff was delayed until Saturday. For once, you can’t blame coronavirus

https://t.co/AWVIFgeMfT

name: politico
text:
The astronauts now have to trudge back to their quarantine, where they’ve been holed up since May 13. This pre-flight protocol isn’t new for the pandemic. For years, astronauts have isolated before launch to keep them from bringing sicknesses into space

https://t.co/AWVIFgeMfT

name: politico
text:
In at least a dozen states, health departments have inflated testing numbers or deflated death tallies by changing criteria for who counts as a coronavirus victim and what counts as a coronavirus test

https://t.co/WIhQqOmr71

name: politico
text: The leader of one of the world’s most prominent development banks today accused the U.S.  — its biggest shareholder — of a lack of leadership, and called for a new global agreement for development financing to help repair economic damage from the pandemic https://t.co/t9l8PcnbYq https://t.co/C5ILRtSU0Y

name: politico
text:
EBRD President Suma Chakrabati said the amount of private and public financing now required to fix economies is a quantum leap beyond the current capacity of multilateral financial institutions. 

“We need to go back to the drawing board,” he said
https://t.co/ny4VC7G4A8

name: politico
text:
Former Texas Rep. Sam Johnson, a military pilot who spent years at a prisoner of war in Vietnam before serving more than two decades in Congress, died today at age 89

https://t.co/OPOJclW9Ak

name: politico
text:
Former Texas Rep. Sam Johnson, a military pilot who spent years as a prisoner of war in Vietnam before serving more than two decades in Congress, died today at age 89

https://t.co/OPOJclW9Ak

name: politico
text:
The White House is renewing a push to end “surprise” medical bills — possibly as part of the next coronavirus rescue package — in a bid to deliver on protecting insured patients from sometimes staggering costs of emergency or out-of-network care

https://t.co/TfgXZlhLkk

name: politico
text:
Experts across our newsroom unpack the essential news of the day and provide the context you need in our POLITICO Dispatch podcast. Subscribe and listen today. 
https://t.co/DPUpEFD3lT https://t.co/9qaEHk7BhJ

name: politico
text:
A House member voted by proxy for the first time ever. 

But the rule change that allowed it to happen has become a bitter partisan flashpoint.

https://t.co/6RHRwUcphH

name: politico
text:
California Gov. Newsom’s rapid reopening strategy is drawing concerns from lawmakers and public health officials who fear the governor is basing decisions more on political pressure than science

https://t.co/btz5qLevjK

name: politico
text:
An event-planning company that received one of the largest federal contracts to provide produce, meat and dairy to hungry families has yet to deliver the much-needed boxes to food banks across the Southwest

https://t.co/pSNcZwmx1O

name: politico
text:
A bipartisan proposal to change how the feds surveil U.S. persons could raise foreign partners’ concerns about sharing intelligence with the U.S., DOJ officials told us hours before an expected vote on the change

https://t.co/0gXNMPuJLu

name: politico
text:
It was the pandemic, Twitter says, that freed the company to attach fact-check warnings to a pair of Trump’s tweets

https://t.co/5I1RJRxt7h

name: politico
text:
The leader of one of the world’s most prominent development banks today accused the U.S. of a lack of leadership, and called for a new global agreement for development financing to help repair economic damage from the pandemic

https://t.co/ny4VC7G4A8

name: politico
text:
New Jersey is recovering from Covid-19. The question now is whether the state can pull together the resources it will need to sustain that recovery and blot out future outbreaks

https://t.co/65SbvdZcJD

name: politico
text:
Opinion: By mixing up the real with the fake threats, Trump keeps everybody on edge, wondering if this time he’ll follow through. The constant stream of threats enslaves the news media to Trump, and their reports terrify his targets

https://t.co/LBuXLCrvjA

name: politico
text:
The coming few months will say a lot about the state of the country, the public’s psyche and how much death and illness it’s willing to accept

https://t.co/yiexzqQ8fI

name: politico
text: Contrary to conventional wisdom, famed Democratic pollster Stan Greenberg says Elizabeth Warren would bring the biggest political upside as Biden's VP pick https://t.co/pZsSsuN4AO

name: politico
text: Today, Congress will take its first big step to revamp the emergency small business lending program that lawmakers created to avert massive layoffs during the pandemic https://t.co/mtJYbGP6uC

name: politico
text: The president will sign an executive order today looking to smack down on social media companies. The order was being written and rewritten last night, but we were told it is going to be quite pointed. https://t.co/xHVxkcGuPr

name: politico
text:
Why sign up? Because decisions made in Washington & Beijing will shape the rest of our lives:
• the climate we inhabit
• the technology we use
• the way we interact with government
• the likelihood of war or peace
• the direction of financial markets
https://t.co/dX5uzcPLuL

name: politico
text:
One big thing to watch for now: the global race to develop a vaccine for the coronavirus.

Voters say their views of U.S. global influence will be largely unshaken, even if China discovers the vaccine first, according to a POLITICO/Morning Consult poll. 
https://t.co/5zeyhpov0j

name: politico
text:
But we should be much more worried. “Whoever finds a workable vaccine right now basically rules the world,” a former U.S. national security official said.

And China is fired up for the race.
https://t.co/5zeyhpov0j

name: politico
text:
China has pledged to make the vaccine a “global public good” if the country is first. But what (if any) concessions will Beijing wring from countries in exchange? 

Will Trump try to talk down the safety of a Chinese vaccine —  and will it work? https://t.co/5zeyhpov0j

name: politico
text:
Any questions about the U.S.-China relationship? Ask our China Watcher author @dwertime anything during his live Q&A today 👇
https://t.co/QBQcx3cKxN

name: politico
text: “We have a different policy than, I think, Twitter on this,” Zuckerberg told Fox News https://t.co/s44w8LfpWC

name: politico
text:
The United States could sanction Beijing, even take in Hong Kong refugees. But the consequences of overreach could be devastating for city residents.

https://t.co/hsLtP63sbN

name: politico
text: Montanans will pick candidates in two competitive statewide races on Tuesday, as Democrats hope to compete in a place that heavily voted for President Trump in 2016 https://t.co/c2WcFtHZ0a

name: politico
text: Democratic lawmakers introduced a bill that would earmark $50 billion for child care providers. They say the money is needed as businesses begin to resume normal operations and working families need child care. https://t.co/RexKSiORTz

name: politico
text: Boris Johnson’s top aide’s drive from his parents’ property in Durham to Barnard Castle might have constituted a “minor breach” of lockdown regulations “that would have warranted police intervention,” a police investigation concluded https://t.co/QE0f2sJL9P

name: politico
text: President Trump offered his first expression of sympathy today in observance of the milestone of 100,000 American coronavirus deaths by tweeting his condolences https://t.co/6DS2gHRWv0

text:

name: politico
text: House Democrats are throwing their weight behind recent calls for the FTC to investigate TikTok — the Chinese-owned video app that has long been a GOP target https://t.co/Q6Do0YQEqZ

name: politico
text:
Pelosi said she asked the House’s doctor if she should take a test after she was potentially exposed to the virus by a fellow congresswoman.

“He said no, you don’t have any symptoms, and your proxy was not such that it would justify that,” Pelosi said 
https://t.co/KNmBgJsTr6

name: politico
text:

text:

text:

https://t.co/bmhYtwFHq2

name: politico
text: The future of Hong Kong is hanging in the balance. Many are now openly wrestling with the question of what the West can actually do to bend the course of events in Hong Kong. The short answer: not much. https://t.co/rbR7fGvydc https://t.co/Phg4BpN99M

name: politico
text:
Nancy Pelosi today called the called the milestone of 100,000 U.S. coronavirus deaths “a scar on our nation.”

She added ,"we've got to get a handle on the challenge that we face. And we can only do that if we test, if we trace and then if we treat.."

name: politico
text:
The European Commission doesn’t need Donald Trump. It has Miley Cyrus.

Cyrus and other American celebrities and big-name philanthropists have joined the EU-led push to raise money for tests, therapies and vaccines shifts

name: politico
text: President Trump is finally set to deliver on his long-threatened campaign to launch a counterstrike against social media companies that have fact-checked, downgraded or booted some of his most vocal online supporters https://t.co/RZAMGM5A6S

name: politico
text:
The White House won't make its usual economic forecast this summer.

Those projections — which administrations have typically published each summer since the 1970s — would surely reflect the steep downturn caused by the pandemic
https://t.co/4DRmqm5fYc

name: politico
text: Since the outset of the Covid-19 pandemic, there have been more than 1,400 executive actions issued across 30+ states. Now, with @POLITICOPro’s federal & state regulatory tracking tool, you can monitor them all in one place. https://t.co/P12IK7dX8Y

name: politico
text: President Trump's attempt to punish companies like Twitter, Google and Facebook for alleged anti-conservative bias takes aim at the online industry's most-cherished legal protections — but the shot could ultimately be a glancing blow https://t.co/m1oJs2FgaR https://t.co/nIRWYUInfe

name: politico
text:
RT @viaCristiano: Barr says they're preparing federal legislation on Section 230 that they'll be "sending over shortly" to OMB, but says it's premature to say what it will do. 

Trump then chimes in: “One of the things we may do, Bill, is just remove or totally change 230."Barr says they're preparing federal legislation on Section 230 that they'll be "sending over shortly" to OMB, but s… https://t.co/DECjwv0VgM

name: politico
text: RT @viaCristiano: Trump says "if it were legal" he would shut down Twitter. It's not.

name: politico
text:
Opinion: By buying up "junk" bonds, the Fed is offering the globe’s wealthiest investors the chance to purchase high-yield bonds.

They’re being presented with all the upside that comes with a junk bond, but none of the risk that, before now, made it junk
https://t.co/qcFn9J0ZHl

text: The House on Thursday overwhelmingly passed legislation that would relax restrictions on emergency government-backed loans designed to avoid mass layoffs at small businesses during the pandemic, a major restructuring of the popular aid program https://t.co/4IVwSujVFH

name: politico
text:
Earlier this month, pollster Stan Greenberg briefed Biden's inner circle on two battleground polls. 

The slide presentation, obtained by POLITICO, made a blunt conclusion on the best VP choice for November: 

“Senator Warren is the obvious solution"

https://t.co/pZsSsuN4AO
